content:
That's a great choice! The audiobook version of "All the Light We Cannot See" is an excellent way to experience the story. Zach Appelman's narration is wonderful, and he brings a depth and nuance to the characters that will really enhance your listening experience.

I completely agree with you about audiobooks being perfect for commutes. They're a great way to make the most of your time, and they can really help you stay on top of your reading goals. Plus, there's something special about being able to immerse yourself in a story while you're on the go.

If you're looking for more audiobook recommendations or have any questions about audiobook platforms, feel free to ask. I'm always happy to chat about audiobooks!

Now, get ready to be transported to 1940s Europe, and enjoy your journey with Marie-Laure and Werner.
